author: jeff morton

review: I spent some time researching what would be the best for my mom. I am a techy so my first idea was to build one myself, maybe use a rasberry pi or the likes. After some serious reading I decided against this. Ease of use for mom was critical for this project. I decided on the Amazon Fire TV for this reason. The simple install and use of this device is great!. I love the included remote and voice search. Amazon and Netflix buffers up fast and streams seamlessly, with great quality. I have not tried other services yet. I got stuck on the first four seasons of Walking Dead. Got through them all in three and a half days :) . I think i will get a Fire TV myself and then do another solution to grab my content from the NAS and play it on the TV also. That's how much I like this thing. Great job Amazon!

review: I haven't had much of a chance to use it yet, I have the local telephone company for my internet and telephone and when I plugged it in it shorted out my telephone and when I had a service call they indicated my internet "office" wasn't strong enough to support this state of the art equipment.  So I must rethink my internet situation but when I did have it hooked up it was wonderful of what I was able to see and loved the tutorial for a not so computer saavy person. Am anxious to try it again when I have new internet service that is capable of supporting this type of equipment.
author: A Customer

review: I feel badly for those who are disappointed with Amazon Fire.  I'm 68 years old, read the directions, set it up and began watching Prime shows immediately.  I use my phone for a wireless connection and the entire set up was flawless.  The reception was excellent.  I don't have cable and got rid of it five or more years ago.  I do still have Chromecast and have been pleased with it.  I'll just move it to another tv in my home.
